page.title: 03TEIGNMOUTH GOLF COURSE
page.content: The area of Little Haldon Hill in the east of this block consists of relatively poor soils developed on Upper Greensand rock.These soils are not very suitable for agriculture,and have a heath vegetation.Part of this area has been taken over for the Teignmouth Golf course,following on from an earlier use as a World War 2 airfield.The golf course has led to an improvement in the soil,with good grass growth.Golfers have spectacular views on clear days east to Exmouth and East Devon.
